thread.title: Former area standout Hicks leads Elon golf tournament
thread.title_full: Former area standout Hicks leads Elon golf tournament

author: Times-News
title: Former area standout Hicks leads Elon golf tournament
text: Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 1:08 AM Updated Oct 20, 2015 at 1:10 AM By Times-News Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 1:08 AM Updated Oct 20, 2015 at 1:10 AM East Carolina’s Jacob Hicks leads the Elon Invitational for men’s golf by two shots after the fall tournament’s first two rounds Monday. The final round is set for today at Alamance Country Club. Hicks, a former standout at Alamance Christian School, is at 6-under-par 136. He followed his 1-under 70 in the opening round with a 5-under 66 to lead Elon’s Jonathan DiIanni and Virginia Commonwealth’s Adam Ball, who are 4-under for the tournament. In the team competition, East Carolina is 11 strokes ahead of second-place Elon and 14 strokes ahead of third-place Charleston Southern. The last college golf event held by Elon at Alamance Country Club was the 1982 NAIA national championship. By Times-News
